meanings.definition: To scold more severely or loudly than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outscolded her sister for breaking the vase.
meanings.sent2: The teacher outscolded the students for not completing their homework.
meanings.sent3: The mother playfully outscolded her son for eating all the cookies.
meanings.sent4: His boss outscolded him like a thunderstorm for being late again.
meanings.sent5: The coach outscolded the players to motivate them to perform better.

meanings.definition: To have been scolded more severely or loudly than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He felt embarrassed when he was outscolded in front of his friends.
meanings.sent2: The employee was outscolded by the manager for making a mistake.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked guilty after being outscolded for knocking over the plant.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a child being outscolded by her parents for coming home late.
meanings.sent5: The student was outscolded by the principal in front of the whole school.
